intro: Syncolostemon macranthus, commonly known as the large-flowered synnema, is a herbaceous plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Commelinaceae, which includes a variety of flowering plants known for their ornamental value. The plant features lance-shaped leaves and produces showy, clustered inflorescences with bright red or orange flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its striking appearance, it is cultivated as a decorative plant in botanical gardens and private collections.
